# init(forItemWith:)

**Initializer**

Creates and returns a layout attributes object for the item at the specified index path.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor convenience init(forItemWith indexPath: IndexPath)
```

## Parameters

- **indexPath**: The index path of the item. You can use this information to identify the item in your appâ€™s data structures. This parameter must contain a valid value.

## Return Value

A new layout attributes object containing the initial attributes for the item.

## Discussion

Call this method when you need to create a layout attributes object for an item in a collection view. Items are the main type of content presented by a collection view. Items are grouped into sections, although a collection view may have only one section. This method assigns the provided index path to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCollectionViewLayoutAttributes/indexPath] property of the returned object.

## Creating Layout Attributes

- **init(forSupplementaryViewOfKind:with:)**: Creates and returns a layout attributes object for a supplementary view based on the specified information.
- **init(forDecorationViewOfKind:with:)**: Creates and returns a layout attributes object for a decoration view based on the specified information.
- **init(forInterItemGapBefore:)**: Creates and returns a layout attributes object for an inter-item gap view at the specified index path.
